definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
to scald/to burn (by scalding)/to blanch (cooking)/to heat (sth) up in hot water/to perm/to iron/scalding hot

sentences.english: Presently, Peroxidase is employed as indicator for blanching treatments of vegetables.
sentences.chinese: 目前蔬菜的熱燙終點以過氧化物酶作爲指示劑來確定。

sentences.english: Touching the hot iron made his finger blister.
sentences.chinese: 他的手指因碰到熱燙鬥而起泡。

sentences.english: Finally blanching enhances the color of most vegetables and fruits.
sentences.chinese: 最後熱燙增強了大部分水果和蔬菜的顏色。

sentences.english: Parboiling, or blanching, cooks the lobster just enough so that the meat can be removed from the shell.
sentences.chinese: 或熱燙，廚師龍蝦剛剛足以使肉可以刪掉從殼。

sentences.english: Do you want a cold wave or an ordinary perm?
sentences.chinese: 完全需要冷燙還是熱燙？

definition: the spongy, white pulp inside the stem of rush plants, used as a wick for oil lamps
variant of 附會|附会[fu4 hui4]
